title: Is Now the Time for National Identity Cards?
sub_head: What America needs is the political will and an efficient bureaucratic infrastructure to ensure that the card’s distribution is universally inclusive.
body:
Regarding Michael Segal’s “America Needs a National Identity Card” (op-ed, Jan. 21): We already have something like it and it’s called a “Passport Card.” It’s the size of a credit card and issued by the State Department. It verifies identity, nationality and place of birth, and can be used in lieu of a passport or a REAL ID-compliant driver’s license on U.S. domestic flights.
What America needs is the political will and an efficient bureaucratic infrastructure (please see Daniel Henninger’s same-day, same-page “Joe Biden’s Super State” Wonder Land column) to ensure that the card’s distribution is universally inclusive.
Let’s hope the template for its rollout isn’t the one used for the Covid vaccine.
Ira Sohn
New York
